column2: we went a little crazy and got three items.  From what I read
column3: we had to get the Pork Belly Poutine.   That was some good eatin'.  Thick cut fries that were crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside
column6: and sausage gravy.  It was a big hit and plenty to share.  The Portobello Mushroom Fries were good as well.  For my entree I went with the Cajun Brick Chicken.  I usually do not order chicken at these kind of restaurants
column8: and it was delicious.  The chicken was cooked to perfection and seasoned just right.  It was served with a heaping mound of dirty rice and crisp green beans.  Get this!  We all shared the mac and cheese
column9: which everyone loved.  A little birdie whispered to our waiter that we were celebrating a birthday and they provided an awesome mini birthday cake with a candle.  We also shared the Red Velvet Churros which were amazing
column10: especially with the cream cheese dipping sauce.
